      • getPrototypeMessage

        public static MessagePayload getPrototypeMessage(java.util.UUID uuid)
        This method returns an empty prototype object of the right class.
        Parameters:
        uuid - the UUID of the message type
        Returns:
        a prototype object that can be employed to deserialize JSON objects

      • createMessage

        public static java.util.Optional<MessagePayload> createMessage(byte[] networkMessage)
        Factory method that creates a message object of the right subclass based on the network messages represented as a byte array. In contrast to deserialize, this method is static.
        Parameters:
        networkMessage - the network message received from the network
        Returns:
        the Optional\ object deserialized from the networkMessage

      • deserialize

        public java.util.Optional<MessagePayload> deserialize(byte[] networkMessage)
        Deserializes a message according the current class. Essentially, the UUID is used to discover a prototype object of the right message type. This prototype object will then determine the value of this.getClass() and, thus, for how jackson should perform deserialization.
        Parameters:
        networkMessage -
        Returns:
        Optional
